title: Web Development Intern
description:
**Position:** 
 Web Developer Intern
 



**Company Name:** 
 AVA Technology
 



**Work Mode:** 
 Remote
 



**Stipend:** 
 ‚Çπ25,000 per month
 



**Work Schedule:** 
 Full\\-time, 5 working days per week
 



**Experience Level:** 
 Students / Freshers
 



  





 AVA Technology is looking for a Web Developer Intern to support ongoing website and application development projects. This role offers practical exposure to both frontend and backend tasks, with opportunities to work on live assignments under the guidance of experienced developers.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 The internship is suitable for students and recent graduates who have a foundation in web technologies and want to strengthen their development skills in a real project environment.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Develop, update, and test responsive websites and web applications.
* Write structured and well\\-documented code using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and common frameworks such as React, Angular, or Node.js.
* Integrate APIs and work with databases including MySQL or MongoDB.
* Coordinate with designers and backend developers to support project workflows.
* Identify and fix bugs or performance issues.
* Contribute to improving usability, performance, and overall user experience.
* Keep track of new tools, techniques, and trends relevant to modern web development.



  





**Who We‚Äôre Looking For** 



* Students or recent graduates in Computer Science, IT, or related fields.
* Basic understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and responsive web design.
* Familiarity with UI/UX fundamentals and a problem\\-solving mindset.
* Curiosity to learn new technologies and willingness to work collaboratively.
* Ability to follow instructions, meet timelines, and maintain clear documentation.

title: Full Stack Web Developer
description:
About Associative
 



 Welcome to Associative, a premier software development and consulting powerhouse headquartered in the vibrant technological hub of Pune, Maharashtra, India. Founded as a dynamic partnership firm on February 1, 2021, we specialize in a wide range of technology solutions, from cutting\\-edge Web and Mobile Development to AI/ML, Blockchain, and Game Development.
 



  





 At our core, we are a dedicated team of IT innovators and problem\\-solvers, passionate about transforming visionary ideas into tangible, impactful, and scalable digital realities. Our operational philosophy is anchored in radical transparency and a holistic approach to building complete, robust, and polished solutions that are engineered for long\\-term maintainability.
 



  





 Job Description
 



 We are seeking a passionate and talented Full Stack Web Developer to join our growing team. This is an excellent opportunity for a fresh graduate to start a career in a dynamic environment, working on diverse and advanced projects.
 



  





 As a Full Stack Developer at Associative, you will be involved in crafting exceptional digital experiences, utilizing modern front\\-end and back\\-end technologies.
 



  





 Qualifications

 Education: Any Graduate
 



 Must Have: Own Laptop for work (mandatory)
 



 Languages: Proficiency in Hindi, English, and Marathi (for workplace communication)
 



  





 What We Offer
 



 Employment Type: Full\\-time, Permanent

 Office Hours: 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM, Monday to Saturday
 



  





 Our Technology Focus (Relevant for learning and growth)
 



 Our expertise covers a wide range of modern web technologies, including:
 



  





 Front\\-End: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like React, Angular, Vue.js, Next.js, etc.
 



 Back\\-End: Node.js (Express.js), Python (Django, Flask, FastAPI), PHP (Laravel), Java (Spring Boot), and more.
 



 Databases: SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (MongoDB, Redis).
 



  





 DevOps: Docker, AWS, GCP, Azure.
 



 This role offers exposure to many of these technologies through our diverse service portfolio.
 



  





 Associative Khandve Complex, Yojana Nagar, Lohegaon \\- Wagholi Road, Lohegaon, Pune, (M.H), India ‚Äì 411047
 


* Find us on Google: Search "Associative Pune"

title: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test
description:
Construction is the 2nd largest industry in the world (4x the size of SaaS!). But unlike software (with observability platforms such as AppDynamics and Datadog), construction teams lack automated feedback loops to help projects stay on schedule and on budget. Without this observability, construction wastes a whopping $3T per year because glitches aren‚Äôt detected fast enough to recover.
   

  

 Doxel AI exists to bring computer vision to construction, so the industry can deliver what society needs to thrive. From hospitals to data centers, from foreman to VPs of construction, teams use Doxel to make better decisions everyday. In fact, Doxel has contributed to the construction of the facilities that provide many of the products and services you use everyday.
   

  

 We have LLM\\-driven automation, classic computer vision, deep learning ML object detection, a low\\-latency 3D three.js web app, and a complex data pipeline powering it all in the background. We‚Äôre building out new workflows, analytics dashboards, and forecasting engines. Join us in bringing AI to construction!
   

  

 We're at an exciting stage of scale as we build upon our growing market momentum. Our software is trusted by Shell Oil, Genentech, HCA healthcare, Kaiser, Turner, Layton and several others. Join us in bringing AI to construction!
   

  

**The Role**
 A Senior SDET with Doxel is driving quality in next\\-generation, local\\-first web applications. You'll be leading test automation efforts across real\\-time and batch data processing and interactive frontends to ensure reliability and performance. If you're passionate about shift\\-left testing, automation, and embedding rigorous validation at every stage, this role is for you.
   

  

 You will define and implement Doxel‚Äôs test automation strategy, ensuring scalability and reliability across frontend, backend, and data pipelines. Your expertise in CI/CD integration, performance testing, and security validation will enable seamless execution of AI\\-driven analytics, 360\\-degree video processing, and massive dataset handling. Your work will empower construction teams with precise, real\\-time decision\\-making tools.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are obsessed with preventing issues before they arise, ensuring robust automation and infrastructure. You excel in complex systems, balancing client\\-side computation, real\\-time data, and backend integrations. You champion developer autonomy, mentor engineers, and build automation frameworks that enhance velocity without sacrificing reliability.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Own and scale test automation across frontend, backend, and data pipelines to support fast, reliable releases
* Develop UI and API test suites that push the limits of performance using Three.js, DuckDb, and WebAssembly
* Streamline CI/CD, integrating automated regression, load, and chaos testing for dependable deployments
* Create and refine greenfield regression suites that evolve with the product
* Embed automation early, ensuring testing accelerates development instead of slowing it down
* Guide and support engineers in building a strong testing culture with practical, scalable best practices


**What You Bring To Doxel**
* 4\\+ years in test automation frameworks (Playwright, Cypress, Selenium, PyTest, Jest, JUnit)
* 6\\+ years of hands\\-on coding in TypeScript, Python, or Java, building and extending test frameworks
* Experience testing high\\-performance frontend applications (WebGL/Three.js, WebAssembly, client\\-side databases)
* Strong backend API testing skills, including database validation and large\\-scale data pipeline testing
* Proficiency in CI/CD (GitHub Actions, CircleCI, Buildkite) and infrastructure\\-as\\-code testing
* Knowledge of performance testing tools (k6, Locust, JMeter) and security best practices
* Passion for developer productivity, reducing MTTD/MTTR
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related technical field


 Pay is based on factors such as location, skill level, qualifications, competencies, and overall experience. Options may be included as an additional part of the package.
   

  

 Doxel also provides comprehensive health/dental/vision benefits for employees and their families, an Unlimited PTO policy, a 401(k) program, and a flexible work environment among other benefits.
   

  

 Doxel is an equal opportunity employer and actively seeks diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
   

  

 Join us in revolutionizing construction technology‚Äîwhere every line of code directly impacts real\\-world projects.
   

  

 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.
